comments.content:
As you can see - it’s cut out of wood.

Or am I silly for replying? If it’s a joke - ha ha.

Nick Cooke

well.. axually it was not meant as a joke. I loved the photo so I wanted to post it somewhere at Typophile for you guys.

however..  
we could make this a legal thread by asking what the font is for:  
**type chess set**

The “type chess set” is [Bernhard](http://web.archive.org/web/20091109221317/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/bernhard-boldcond/bold-condensed/?testdrive=custom%3D0%26dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D25%26w%3D720%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3Dtype%2520chess%2520set%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3D%26seed%3D46).

I hadn’t really noticed before, but Bernhard’s “t” looks like a baby bottle. Funny.

<cite>As you can see - it’s cut out of wood.</cite>

That would made it a wooden type.

Type chess set is not a sans - that’s why I thought you meant the wood.

Nick Cooke

Nick  
I meant the wood.. but as I posted before.. I just wanted to show this fine work of using type.

Thanx Jan + Aaron for Bernhard
